intro: Umbilicus lineatus, commonly known as the linear umbilic, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinct central vein, giving it a linear appearance. Umbilicus lineatus is known for its delicate structure and is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
